chart_description: This chart shows the percentage of CPU time used by different applications on the server, with 100% equaling the time used by one core. It helps in identifying which applications are using the most CPU time and optimizing their usage to prevent overloading the system.

dimension_descriptions.VMs: The name of the virtual machine to which the CPU usage belongs.
dimension_descriptions.agent_sd: The name of the Agent sender (SD) that sent the data.
dimension_descriptions.apps.plugin: The name of the Netdata plugin that provided the data.
dimension_descriptions.containers: The name of the container where the application is running.
dimension_descriptions.ebpf.plugin: The name of the eBPF plugin that provided the data.
dimension_descriptions.go.d.plugin: The name of the custom Go program that provided the data.
dimension_descriptions.httpd: The name of the Apache HTTP Server.
dimension_descriptions.kernel: The name of the kernel process that provided the data.
dimension_descriptions.kube-proxy: The name of the Kubernetes proxy server.
dimension_descriptions.kubelet: The name of the Kubernetes Node Agent (kubelet).
dimension_descriptions.metrics-server: The name of the Kubernetes Metrics Server.
dimension_descriptions.netdata: The name of the Netdata daemon.
dimension_descriptions.nosql: The name of the NoSQL database process that provided the data.
dimension_descriptions.other: The name of the process that generated this data, but does not belong to any other category.
dimension_descriptions.sql: The name of the SQL database process that provided the data.
dimension_descriptions.system: The name of the system process that provided the data.
dimension_descriptions.tc-qos-helper: The name of the TC-QoS helper process that provided the data.
